intro: Psychotria leiophylla, commonly known as the white-leaf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many plants with ornamental and medicinal uses. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves that are typically a deep green color. It produces small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow, often arranged in clusters. Psychotria leiophylla is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and understoreys.
